topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack 1.0: Command Line Interface- EON

body.p: The EON client CLI package provides an http-client coupled command-line tool for managing Eon (ESX management) services.
You can issue the following command using the EON client CLI package in the undercloud:

section.title: Help
section.p: You can display help for this program or one of its sub-programs.

section.title: Help Subcommand
section.p: You get two sets of arguments: Positional (mandatory) and Optional arguments (all mandatory fields are marked within [Required]).
You can use the following commands to view the help.

section.title: Bash-completion
section.p: Prints all of the commands and options to the standard output.

section.title: List vCenters
section.p: You can view the list of vCenters in your cloud environment.

section.title: View vCenter details
section.p: You can view the details of the specific vCenter.

section.title: Add vCenter
section.p: You can add the vCenter to the EON database. You must enter all the arguments to add the vCenter; otherwise you will be prompted to enter them.
Note: HPE Helion OpenStack supports three vCenters.

li.p: <VCENTER_PROXY_CONFIG_FILE>: File location of the proxy configuration.

section.title: Update vCenter
section.p: You can update the exisitng vCenter to the EON database. You must enter all the arguments to add the vCenter; otherwise you will be prompted to enter them.

section.title: Delete vCenter
section.p: Important: If you have any imported cluster ensure that you have deactivated them and then un-import the cluster(s) before executing the delete command.
vCenter delete fails:

ul.li: if you have any imported clusters that are activate clusters.

section.p: You can delete the vCenter from the EON database.

section.title: List vswitch
section.p: You can view the list of vswitches of vCenter.

section.title: View vswitch details
section.p: You can view the vswitch details. The ID of vCenter and MOID of vswitch will be displayed.

section.title: Host details
section.p: You can view the list of hosts of cluster details of the host when cluster moid is specified.

section.title: List clusters
section.p: You can view the list of clusters available for the given vCenter.

section.title: View cluster details
section.p: You can view of the details of the specific cluster.

section.title: Import clusters
section.p: You can import the clusters in the EON database under the give vCenter.
In the vCenter you can import the cluster(s). One vCenter can have multiple clusters.

section.title: Update a cluster
section.p: You can update the cluster details.

section.title: Unimport clusters
section.p: You can un-import the cluster(s) from the EON database under the give vCenter.

section.title: Activate clusters
section.p: You can activate the clusters using the following:

section.title: Deactivate clusters
section.p: You can deactivate clusters.

section.title: List of compute proxy
section.p: View the list of compute proxies.

section.title: Restore proxy
section.p: In case of failure of Proxy-VM, the Compute Proxy VM can be restored to the previous configuration using the following command. In other words, it recreates the Compute Proxy virtual machine with previously activated clusters.

section.title: Required Commands
section.p: The following options must be supplied as arguments or as environment variables.

section.title: OS username
section.p: Username of the keystone (OpenStack environment). Defaults to env[OS_USERNAME].

section.title: OS password
section.p: Password of the keystone (OpenStack environment). Defaults to env[OS_PASSWORD].

section.title: OS tenant ID
section.p: Tenant identification of the OpenStack environment. Defaults to env[OS_TENANT_ID].

section.title: OS authentication URL
section.p: Authentication URL of the OpenStack environment. Defaults to env[OS_AUTH_URL].

section.title: OS authenticationtoken
section.p: Authentication token of the OpenStack environment. Defaults to env[OS_AUTH_TOKEN].
